titleStmt.title: Board of Internal Improvement of Kentucky

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Board of Internal Improvement of Kentucky

body.p: Created by an act of the General Assembly in 1835 to improve transportation in Kentucky. The board consisted of the governor and three appointed officers. Members of the board organized funds to support the construction of the following projects in Kentucky: turnpikes, stage coach lines, canals, dams, and railroad.

ab.bibl:
Ron D. Bryant, "Kenton County" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 488-89.
Leonard P. Curry, "Transportation" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 892-894.
"Board of Internal Improvements" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 94.
